Requirements: 
4 year structural engineering degree
Proficiency with Autocad and able to draft structural plans and details 
Experience with analysis and design software such as ETABS, RAM, Enercalc, etc.
Ability to perform site visits and comfortable using ladders, scaffolds, climbing, etc.
Focused interest in structural engineering and desire to learn.

Respond with resume if interested.
compensation: Pay to be on a per project basis with potential for full time position.

title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Architect
description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled architect with 5 to 10 years of building envelope restoration experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

title: Assistant Project Manager
description:
Job Description:

The Assistant Project Manager will be an integral part of Think Construction, working directly with Project Managers to ensure that every job runs seamlessly. Extreme attention to detail and superior organization are key. The daily responsibilities of the Assistant Project Manager will include maintaining the flow of information between our company and architects, clients, and subcontractors. Candidates must work closely with our site and office teams and will be accountable for the trafficking of all project-related communications--fielding questions, providing submittals, creating schedules, keeping meeting minutes, and more. 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as superior planning and organizational abilities, are required. At Think Construction, we believe strongly in promoting a positive, respectful, supportive, collegial, and collaborative work environment. We believe in creating a work environment that encourages hard work, professionalism, and opportunities for continued learning and growth. We look for candidates who share our vision.

Job Responsibilities:

• Schedule/attend coordination meetings with subcontractors and suppliers
• Obtain pricing and lead time from suppliers/subcontractors
• Track/adjust project schedule and submittals
• Monitor/record/distribute design changes that affect workflow, schedule and budget
• Prepare and execute fixture and material orders 
• Assemble change orders and maintain budget
• Analyze blueprints and prepare estimates 
• Prepare submittals and RFIs for transmittal to architects and designers
• Liaise with architects, site-supers, sub-contractors, and vendors to coordinate work and traffic
• Record and issue minutes of field meetings

Job Requirements:

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
• Ability to consistently multi-task in several capacities on a variety of projects
• Aptitude for meeting deadlines and facilitating others to do so as well
• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word and Adobe Acrobat
• Some experience reading blueprints and specifications
• Familiarity with Procore is a plus

description:

title: Construction Project Manager
description:
The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in the following:
•	5-10 years experience as a Project Manager working in Commercial & Residential construction.
•	Managing multiple projects concurrently from start to finish, including estimating and pre-construction.
•	Coordinating with the Superintendent and subcontractors to develop the project schedule.
•	Reviewing drawings, plans and specifications to create scopes of work and execute contracts.
•	Reviewing submittals including shop drawings.
•	Review and process subcontractor submittals for adherence to the specifications.
•	Managing of project document logs to include RFI's, Transmittals, and Submittals.
•	Managing the Owner and Architect including OAC meetings and creating of minutes.
•	Tracking all permits to ensure project schedule is not impacted.

        and key control.

title: Signal Engineer
description:
Tectonic is currently seeking full-time Signal Engineers to work on various building and infrastructure for upcoming MTA projects in the New York City area.

This position will provide Signal Engineers with the chance to work on high profile, challenging projects that offer the opportunity for professional growth and advancement within the A/E/C industry working for a Top ENR 500 Firm. 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

The essential functions of this position include traveling to various project sites on a daily basis and perform daily surveillance and inspections to verify that all work performed by the Contractor has been completed in accordance with the contract requirements, along with being responsible to ensure quality hold points are being observed and witness all applicable inspection and testing required under the Contract. The Signal Engineer will access and conduct field inspection to enforce NYCT rules and regulations involving the daily field construction need and to ensure contractors are incompliance with all pre-requisite for the work tasks being performed in the field, as well as proper and safe working environment are set up and field works are adequately covered. Such pre-requisite will include but not limited to approve drawings, materials, obtain proper permits and procure NYCT support services such as flagging protection, G.O. and work trains. The Engineer will discuss and coordinate work activities with contractors and field inspectors and will review and ensure that daily reports are properly and accurately recorded with details. Essential functions also include the preparation of Daily Field Reports, communication of deficiencies observed in the field to project managers, contractors, and/or client representatives, and the interpretation of project-related drawings and documents, as well as all other duties as assigned. Field inspectors will prepare detailed daily inspection reports and records all contractor and NYCT personnel on site, work performed, materials used and any incidents and non-conformances occurred in the field.

TO VIEW AND APPLY, PLEASE VISIT: 

QUALIFICATIONS

•	Candidates must possess the following certifications AND a High School Diploma/equivalent:
o	OSHA 30 Hour Safety 
o	Lead Awareness
•	Ability to complete Track Safety and PMG 123 Training Certification;
•	Effective oral and written communication skills; 
•	Must be detail oriented;
•	A valid, clean driver’s license and personal vehicle to travel to job sites is preferred; as regular daily travel is required to various project sites primarily throughout the New York City metro area; 

COMPETITIVE SALARY AND BENEFITS PACKAGE
•	Comprehensive group medical insurance, including health, dental, vision and life
•	Opportunities for professional growth and advancement
•	Tuition reimbursement
•	Paid time off, including vacation, sick and personal
•	Company–observed paid holidays
•	Short and long-term disability coverage
•	Flexible spending accounts for medical expenses and dependent care
•	Commuter benefit plan for public transportation costs
•	401K retirement and profit sharing plan.

We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, and highly encourage resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities. All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected class.
Tectonic participates in the USCIS E-Verify Program to verify that all new hires are authorized to work in the United States.

title: ARCHITECT (New York City)
description:
A Long Island City architectural firm is seeking an experienced Project Manager with related experience for immediate hire.

Desired Skills and Experience
We are seeking a capable self-starter for interesting work on existing buildings including rainscreen application and alteration of existing building and/or interior and exterior restoration and historic preservation.

Applicants can have architectural structural or civil degree and must have knowledge of construction details, construction materials, and assemblies.  Applicants should be organized, self-motivated, and capable of progressing projects to meet predetermined project deadlines.

Responsibilities will include
• Project management
• Preparation of bidding documents and specifications
• Preparation of DOB & LPC filing drawings
• Construction Administration
• Building Investigations, Physical Conditions Survey/Assessment 
• Building Envelope Assessment, Roof & Facade Inspections
• Creation of meeting notes and field reports

About Us
Our principal has over 30 years of experience working in the greater NYC area and an extensive knowledge of construction systems and detailing. Our office is conveniently located in Long Island City with easy access to several subway lines. We have a friendly, informal studio culture, that supports and promotes professional development and advancement. Our work primarily involves the restoration, historic preservation, repair, and alteration of NYC's existing built environment, including prominent members of NYC's skyline. Our office offers a competitive compensation package with generous benefits including health care, 401K plan, and annual profit-sharing bonuses.

Interested candidates should submit a resume, work samples and salary requirements via email
compensation: Competitive compensation package with generous benefits including health care, 401K plan, and annual profit-sharing bonuses.

title: Business Development Leader
description:
CannonDesign has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Development Leader based in our New York City office. We are an integrated global design firm that unites a dynamic team of architects, engineers, strategists, futurists, researchers, and industry specialists driven by a singular goal - to help solve our clients' and society's greatest challenges.    

The successful candidate will be responsible for advancing the office, through business development, marketing, and public relations. Primary responsibilities include: 

• Work closely with office and firm leadership in creating and implementing a strategic business development plan to position the New York City office with target Health, Education and Commercial Interior clients. Assist in the identification of client leads based upon value propositions and strategic initiatives. 
• Develop and maintain a client network within our targeted business areas. Represent the firm at designated local professional conferences and industry events. 
• Work collaboratively with the office leadership to develop a strategic marketing business plan for the New York City office. Meet with the leaders on a regular basis to ensure that the marketing plan is implemented. Monitor business development activities and lead the tracking and reporting metrics. 
• Participate in the development of new business presentations, providing strategic client information gathered during research and market analysis. • Assist in research and intelligence gathering for potential client opportunities in an effort to better position the office to secure the commissions.
 • Work collaboratively with other business development professionals throughout the firm regarding firm-wide marketing and business development activities. 
• Collaborate with marketing team members in the writing, design, and implementation of marketing materials.
  
Qualified candidates must have a Bachelor in Marketing, Communications, Architecture, Engineering, or a related field. A minimum of 10 years of related industry experience with a proven track record in business development required. Experience in the Health, Education and/or Commercial Interiors and market place desired.  Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, Deltek CRM and/or Vision, and Salesforce preferred. Ability to travel domestically required. Must be collaborative, self-driven and entrepreneurial with the ability to maintain and prioritize deadlines. Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with an enthusiasm for innovation are a must. To apply upload your resume to our career site. Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site at .  It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us.  

As a condition of employment, all CannonDesigners are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required time frames and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.    

CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity. We consider all qualified employment applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, partnership status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Individuals who hold legal work authorization applicable to employment at CannonDesign in the United States will be considered without regard to citizenship/alienage.

title: Construction Inspector - Civil/Structural
description:
If you are bold. If you are willing to be original and take risks. If you want to make a difference by improving our infrastructure, then you should be an AV-ator! Alta Vista Solutions nurtures its AV-ators to perform as leaders in our industry, providing innovative engineering solutions and embracing our clients’ challenges as our own. Our mission is to Do Right and give back, while providing a great place to work for our professionals who provide solutions for some of the country’s biggest and most complex infrastructure projects. Perform inspection of contractor’s work to ensure construction activities are in accordance with plans, specifications, and contractual requirements.

Experience with LIRR, NYSDOT, MNR, TBTA or other local agencies preferred

Does the practice of architecture excite you? Are you an architect who thrives on helping your coworkers and clients to achieve their best? Our Project Architects are intermediate level design professionals who act as assistant team leaders responsible for technical and design aspects of our projects. They develop high-quality design and construction documents through hands-on work and coordinate all project issues with consultants, and manage production staff through efficient task delegations and leadership.

Experience developing, organizing, and exercising quality control over drawings and drawing sets
Experience with consultant coordination and ability to recognize deficiencies in consultant-provided content .
Experience conducting material research and meeting vendors to understand materials and products.
Experience “redlining” drawings and delegating production work while being conscious of project deadlines, fees, and contractual obligations.
Experience with oversight and mentorship of junior-level staff through completion of submissions.
Experience organizing and leading site visits and surveys.
DESIRED SKILLS / EDUCATION / CERTIFICATIONS

Professional degree in Architecture Required (B.Arch or M.Arch)
Strong communication & organization skills
Strong time management skills
Advanced knowledge of AutoCAD and Revit
Strong understanding of NYC/NYS codes and NYC zoning regulations
Strong knowledge of building construction, materials, and systems
Licensed Architects preferred
LEED accredited Preferred
Public sector experience preferred

Entrepreneurial attitude.

Paid time off.

An Environmental Professional with a degree in Geology, Engineering, Environmental Science or Industrial Hygiene and 3-5 years of environmental consulting/contracting experience.

The position will include the preparation of detailed work plans and reports, and scheduling, management and oversight of ongoing remediation/redevelopment projects.

Previous experience with the NYC E-designation and NYS Brownfield programs is desirable but not necessary.

title: Construction Estimator.....temp to perm....NYC
description:
Our client, a construction management firm located here in Manhattan, is looking for a quality Estimator to join its team on a temp to perm basis. Prepare estimates by calculating complete takeoffs of scope of work, work collaboratively with groups to discuss feasibility, contact subcontractor to provide bids for trades, prepares subcontractor evaluations and commercial estimates per bid procedure, process and distributes all R.F.I.s for estimating and job addendums and prepare the proposal to submit to the client.

price for the project. Create procedures for tracking, distributing and maintaining of all the project documentation.

description:
We are a world-class multi-disciplinary engineering consulting firm who is seeking a Plumbing/Fire Protection Engineer for our New York, NY office. 

Responsibilities 

Our engineers work on high quality, high-profile, national and international projects. We are currently looking for engineers who will be responsible for the systems design of commercial, institutional, healthcare, and laboratory projects.

2- 15 years’ experience designing plumbing and fire protection systems preferred. (Project experience submitted for consideration should include buildings on which you have actively participated in the project from the design phase through the final construction close-out.) 
Strong working knowledge of building, plumbing, and fire codes 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
Current PE and LEED AP licenses/registrations are preferred.

Our company offers salary commensurate with experience, a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, disability and life insurances, 401k plan, tuition reimbursement, and more.

title: AV/ IT Design Engineer
description:
Audiovisual Design Engineer

We are looking for a Senior AV Design Engineer to work within our Technology consulting practice. Reporting to the principal in charge, this position will focus on leading needs analysis and technology visioning with key clients, as well as leading our internal consulting teams and supporting our clients during all phases of our projects.

Responsibilities include:

Direct involvement in all aspects and phases of audio visual projects (i.e. programming, design, construction administration, etc.) 
Attend internal and client meetings as needed both onsite and remote 
Provide direction and create red lines / sketches to / for production team members and perform QC checks on all deliverables prior to release to clients, architects, construction firms, integrators, etc. 
Create and document AV budgets for projects 
Develop AV system designs and perform all necessary engineering tasks to ensure the designs meet client needs, expectations, and budgets 
Create, QC, and issue equipment lists, system drawings, details, system specifications, etc. 
Work in collaboration with the project manager to ensure the design intent, client needs / must haves, and any field design notes are covered by the system design 
Ensure industry best practices and company standards are used consistently and effectively 
Participate in building and maintaining company standards by conducting lessons learned sessions, by continuing education, and by participating in R&D for new products 
Oversee system integrator efforts as required 
Review submissions and shop drawings 
Respond to RFIs as required 
Assist directly and indirectly with all aspects of site coordination as needed 
Assist directly and indirectly with technical aspects of the system and with system commissioning as required 
Assist directly and indirectly with creation, maintenance, and updating punch lists as required 
Assist directly and indirectly with end user / client training, as required 
Review as-built and closeout documentation for accuracy 
Other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications

Expert knowledge of industry standards in AV system design and integration 
Excellent knowledge of trending technologies available today 
Excellent understanding of different technologies and the ability to properly identify the best solution based on the needs analysis 
Minimum 3 years of experience with designing and engineering AV systems 
Good understanding of heat loads, power requirements, lighting and acoustical environments and their effects on AV system design 
Good understanding of control system programming, GUI design, and the effects it has on AV system design 
Good understanding of audio principles for the purpose of AV design 
Good understanding of collaboration technologies and the options available (i.e. video conferencing end points, soft codecs, instant messaging applications, online meeting services, etc.) 
Familiarity with small, medium, and large scale projects 
Strong math aptitude and logical analysis skills 
Strong interpersonal skills that foster a team environment 
Ability to problem solve independently with a sense of urgency 
Excellent communication skills both verbally and in writing 
Be detail oriented and organized while being able to multitask and shift priorities with ease 
Working knowledge of AutoCAD software 
Working knowledge of various Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, Power Point) 
CTS Certification at a minimum and CTS-D certification mandatory within 12 months of employment
Desired Qualifications but NOT REQUIRED 

Infocomm CTS-D, CTS-I or CTS certification 
Any Infocomm training / education 
PMP certification 
AV manufacturer or industry related training and certifications (i.e. SynAudCon, Crestron, Extron, Biamp, etc.) 
Experience with IT and / or Security system design / integration 
Experience with control system programming 
Experience with indoor / outdoor digital signage technologies 
Any technology consulting experience

Full Benefits, Vacation, Sick Days, Bonuses, 401K plan

description:
Long established fine metal fabrication company using the latest technology including state of the art lasers, CAD/​CAM, waterjets, shears, numerical punching machines, press brakes, engineering, and a diverse workforce seeking candidates with Mechanical Engineering background.
This position is not for square foot take off construction estimating or project management.

Reading, interpreting and understanding drawings (CAD) and hard copy

Experience in sheet metal/​manufacturing industry is very helpful

We offer a challenging, exciting work environment with competitive salary, bonus opportunity and excellent benefits.​ We also provide ample room for professional development and growth!

title: Mechanical Designers
description:
Mechanical Designers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded interdisciplinary research group based in New York City.  These hires will work on the mechanical design and construction of new generations of our custom-built ANTON® supercomputer, collaborating with our team on all phases of system development, from concept to delivery.  This is a limited-term position with an anticipated 12-month contract.

Successful candidates will have expertise in sheet metal and machined part design, including hands-on prototyping and testing of chassis and enclosures, and modeling and drafting in SolidWorks and/or PTC Creo (Pro/Engineer).  They should have a demonstrated ability to design complex, rack-based electronic packaging systems with integrated power and cooling.  Other relevant experience might include plastics design and injection molding, creating assembly drawings, and resolution of DFM/DFA issues.  Excellent analytical and communication skills are required.

We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation to candidates of exceptional ability.

Our research effort is aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below:


D. E. Shaw Research is a New York-based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the fields of biochemistry and molecular biology.  Among the group's current activities is the development of specialized supercomputers designed in part to fundamentally transform the process of drug discovery.

D. E. Shaw Research is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to the goal of building a diverse workforce. We welcome inquiries from all exceptionally well-qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, nationality, national or ethnic origin, religion or religious belief, caste, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, caregiver status, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, disability, or status in any other category protected in this regard by law in any jurisdiction in which the Firm operates.

-Works well in a collaborative setting but must also be able to work independently and proactively on projects without supervision

title: GOSHOW ARCHITECTS IS HIRING: INTERN ARCHITECT I: ENTRY LEVEL JUNIOR
description:
POSITION SUMMARY:	The Intern Architect I is an entry level junior design professional as a student intern or recent graduate who assists their immediate supervisor in cooperation with the project team to develop high quality design and architectural construction documents. The Intern Architect I will learn to apply theoretical knowledge to practical application through day-to-day tasks assigned to them.


PERFORMANCE ACCOUNTABILITY:  This position reports directly to the assigned Project Manager.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:


1.	Design
a.	Provide design support for projects which may include renderings.
b.	Perform elementary design computations.
c.	Understand basic design elements such as proportion, color, light, texture & scale.
d.	Visualize and communicate in two and three dimensions.
e.	Assist in the preparation of presentation materials including physical and digital model building.
f.	Encouraged to try to solve design problems using experience, judgment and education.
g.	Expected to ask for assistance when needed.

2.	Technical
a.	Assist in the preparation and revision of construction documents.
b.	Perform computer tasks according to project CAD standards and project design standards.
c.	Assist in field surveys.
d.	Research equipment, materials and finishes selection from catalogs.
e.	May prepare design drawings from sketches by others.

3.	Management
a.	Demonstrate the firm’s 5 core values: excellence, integrity, initiative, optimism, and humor.
b.	Organize and estimate own time to execute tasks.
c.	Check own work for errors, omissions and legibility.
d.	Coordinate and distribution of submission materials.
e.	Maintain organized work area to provide efficient access to information and project files.

QUALIFICATIONS:

1.	Professional degree in Architecture (or in process of acquiring)
2.	0 - 2 years of architectural office experience.
3.	Basic knowledge of computer software.
4.	Basic design and production skills.
5.	Effective verbal and written communication skills.


CONDITIONS FOR ADVANCEMENT:

1.	Attendance at all in-house Lunch and Learn events.
2.	Active participation in industry related organization
3.	LEED GA within one year of hire
4.	In process of acquiring or initiating IDP
5.	Ability to work efficiently with team members
6.	Satisfy all qualifications listed in Intern Architect II

Please submit a resume to jobs@goshow.com and please put INTERN ARCHITECT I: ENTER LEVEL JUNIOR​ in the subject line

description:

title: Maintenance Manger
description:
United Cerebral Palsy Associations of New York State, Inc. d/b/a Constructive Partnerships Unlimited (CP Unlimited) is one of New York City's largest and most wide spread Community Living Organizations with programs dedicated to enhancing the lives of people with disabilities. CP Unlimited was formerly known as Cerebral Palsy Associations of NYS.  Our new name better reflects our wide array of services and programs and the diversity of people with disabilities that our agency supports.

CP Unlimited is currently seeking a Maintenance Manager to advise and schedule trade mechanics for maintenance and repairs for agency operated facilities, to assist us in our mission to provide safe and comfortable living environments for the people we serve. The Maintenance Manager will oversee the implementation of outsourced contracts applicable to building maintenance, life safety, and/or municipal, state and OPWDD regulations. Manage the agencies extermination & bed bug control programs. Conduct facilities assessments identifying, confirming and/or recommending modifications & enhancements pertinent to an aging population and outdated facilities.

To Quality for the position you must possess: 

Minimum of 5 years management experience within the skilled trades.
Knowledge of the practices and techniques of the trades in order to manage plumbing, electrical, carpentry, HVAC and masonry contractors.
PC skills, including MS Office Work and MS Excel
Good communication skills.
Experience preparing scopes of work, layouts, and cost estimates for renovation projects.
Experience working and collaborating with sub-contractors
Familiar with basic reading of blue prints and mechanical drawings.
Familiar with trade tools and equipment for the various trades.
Valid driver’s license. Willing to drive to/from all agency facilities.

CP Unlimited values and supports its employees by offering them competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. CP Unlimited invests in its staff over the long term and strives to provide opportunities for professional growth within the agency. The organization always has an eye to the future, exploring ways to improve and expand its services.

EOE

title: Facade / Building Envelope Architect
description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking an  
architect with 2 to 5 years of building envelope restoration experience.  

As a building envelope restoration consultant SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of interesting and challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings -- including courthouses, schools, universities, churches and hospitals.  We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls. We take pride in being an industry leader in such practice areas as Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. 

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.  

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.  

Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).  

SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.  

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.  

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday. 

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away. 

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).  

Note: Our thanks in advance to those submitting applications; only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.   

For additional information, visit our website at

title: Structural Engineer
description:
Job Description:

We are currently seeking structural engineers at multiple levels to join our team. As a structural engineer, you will work with other team members in our highly collaborative environment to assure that designs are developed in accordance with appropriate codes and standards, quality control objectives are achieved, and project goals are met within the schedule and budget. This is an outstanding opportunity for a structural engineer to work on a variety of high-profile projects throughout the region. 

Duties and Responsibilities:

- Coordinate with architects, contractors, owners, and other engineers from the initial planning stages through final construction.
- Determine design criteria using relevant codes and standards.
- Analyze and/or prepare models and calculations for various structural elements and systems by using various software and/or hand calculations.
- Develop contract documents, including construction drawings and technical specifications
- Produce schematic and detailed designs and evaluation of planning and concept alternatives
- Review shop drawings, RFI's.
- Perform field inspections and write inspection reports.

Skills and Qualifications:

- Familiar with latest version of AutoCAD, Revit, ETABS, SAP2000, SAFE, RAM, Excel.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Ability to effectively work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
- Must be eligible to work in the United States

Entry Level Candidates:
- Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.

Intermediate Level Candidates:
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
- 3+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.

Advance Level Candidates:
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
- 8+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.
- NYS PE License
compensation: The salary is based on level of experience.

title: Architectural Designer
description:

title: Construction Project manager
description:
Position: Construction Project Manager

Salary position: (Y) DOE

Design Focused High End Construction and Millwork company is looking for a qualified assistant project manager. Candidates must have 2 years experience managing NYC residential and commercial projects. 

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
•	Develop and manage project schedules for each project and adjust according to the demands of each project
•	Procure and manage shop drawings approvals
•	Manage projects with the budget/bid in mind to ensure profitability. 
•	Develop change orders for clients to sign off on for all extras.
•	Conduct walk-through’s with subcontractors to bid each project and assist in creating project budgets
•	Manage system of project start up and deployment. 
•	Put together project admin binder, project spec binder, site log, project insurance and project correspondence systems.
•	Order project materials, finishes etc
•	Manage employee schedules in accordance with the flow of business and site demands.
•	Schedule subcontractors with site supervisors
•	Responsible for the quality of all work performed by employees and all sub-contractors, through management of and with the site supervisors.
•	Ensure skilled trades work performed is inspected where required
•	Manage projects to cut down on punch-list items.
•	Develop system of listing and checking off all punch list items.
•	Responsible for making sure all punch-list items get completed in a timely manner
Subordinates: Site supervisors, carpenters, laborers, office admin and driver
Skills and Experience Necessary – 
•	Architectural training or degree
•	Architectural drawing
•	Must have a working knowledge of Plumbing and Electrical Circuitry
•	Must have a working knowledge of Architectural and specialty plaster finishes
•	Must be able to read and interoperate structural, mechanical and millwork drawings
•	Must have working knowledge of Structural Steel work

title: Architecture Intern
description:
Position: Part time Intern 2 - 3 days a week with possibility for more depending on workload
Company: Elizabeth Roberts Architects
Office: Gowanus, Brooklyn (2 blocks from the F/G/R subway lines)
Office Hours: 9am to 6pm

Brooklyn based Architecture and Design firm is seeking a summer intern to assist and work closely with our team of architects and designers during the Construction Administration Phase. Our focus is on renovations and additions to townhouses in Brooklyn and Manhattan as well as country homes and barns around the tri-state area.

 Duties for this position may involve: 

- Surveying existing and as-built conditions for our work that is in construction.

- Revising and updating Construction Documents and developing SK’s as required during the course of construction. Producing coordination drawings – plans, sections, elevations, details (autocad)

- Working on 3D models as needed to verify and coordinate existing/as built conditions and proposed work (Rhino)

- Assisting with construction progress documentation – Field Reports, photographs, organizing, storing, and distribution.     

- Assisting with the selection of finishes and specifications.  Assembling Binders and collecting samples as needed for approvals.

- Assisting with the review and verification of Project Submittals.

- Assisting with tracking and reviewing of project financials.  Budgets, Applications for Payment, Change Orders and Lien Releases.

Qualifications:

Familiar with AUTOCAD, RHINO, CS Suite, MS Office

On Site Construction Experience.

Minimum 2 days per week, flexible hours

title: Facade / Building Envelope Architect
description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking an  
architect with 2 to 5 years of building envelope restoration experience.  

As a building envelope restoration consultant SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of interesting and challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings -- including courthouses, schools, universities, churches and hospitals.  We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls. We take pride in being an industry leader in such practice areas as Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. 

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.  

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.  

Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).  

SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.  

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.  

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday. 

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away. 

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).  

Note: Our thanks in advance to those submitting applications; only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.   

For additional information, visit our website at

title: AutoCAD PM/Drafting Positions for Site Safety Plans
description:
PM/Drafting position - Safety design coordinator for a Major NYC Safety Consulting Company
We are looking for a full-time CAD PM/Draftsman to join our dynamic Production team. As a member of this fast-paced, cutting edge group you will work with architects, engineers and construction specialists to handle the drawing and graphic needs for industry leading developers and construction managers.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:
The Safety Design Coordinator will work in a team overseeing project design, construction & project administration. 

Knowledgeable of codes and regulations including NYC Building Code, NYC Fire Code & DOT regulations.

Proficient in reviewing DOB-BEST Squad objections and maintaining Building Code, the client's preferences, and design intent.

Meet with New York City Department of Buildings Plan Examiners to review and obtain approvals of Site Safety Plans.

Good drafting skills. Must be able to balance CAD drafting (For Site Safety Logistics Plans for Alterations, Facade Repairs & New Buildings), project management and coordination. 

Perform Quality Assurance reviews of drawing sets.

Conduct site visits for field measurements and drawing research.

Develop and produce presentation materials, including plans, diagrams, details, etc

Communicate and follow up with clients about specific projects and their goals.

Prepare daily & weekly reports.



Qualifications:
1.	Bachelors Degree in Architecture, Civil engineering or closely related field preferred.
2.	2-5 years architectural design/CAD drafting work experience, minimum 1 year in Project Coordination, or Management.
3.	Must have EXCELLENT computer skills. Proficient in CAD software and/or AutoCAD experience is required. 
        REVIT knowledge is a plus. Proficiency in Photoshop and/or illustrator, PowerPoint, Excel and Word is necessary as well.
4.     Complex problem solving and decision-making skills.
5.	Good written and verbal communication skills
6.	Must be a team player and have the ability to effectively multi-task
7.     Strong leadership, communication and relationship management skills.
8.     Flexibility in a fast-paced changing environment. 
9.     Working knowledge of NYC Building Code, Chapter 33 Safeguards During Construction or   Demolition as well as OSHA 
        CFR 1926 Construction Safety and Health and NYC DOT

We offer a competitive salary (commensurate with experience), with paid vacation and benefits package.
Recent college grads welcome to apply!
compensation: We offer a competitive salary (commensurate with experience), with paid vacation

title: Facade / Building Envelope Architect
description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled architect with 2 to 5 years of building envelope restoration experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

title: Hotel Engineer Wanted!
description:
The World's Tallest Holiday Inn is seeking a Full Time Engineer to:

For more information see details below and to APPLY NOW please click link:


JOB OVERVIEW: Perform general maintenance work to ensure hotel maintenance quality standards are achieved and maintained.

REPORTS TO:	Chief Engineer

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: 

1.	Assist with preventative maintenance and complete report work orders such as replacing ceiling tiles, light bulbs, patching vinyl, etc., to maintain the hotel and keep the product quality standard. 
2.	Perform preventative maintenance assignments on a scheduled basis (e.g., "room care").
3.	Assist in checking electrical systems such as air conditioning controls, television sets, lighting systems, and make minor repairs and/or replacement.
4.	Assist in checking and making routine repairs and assist on major repairs of all hotel equipment including small appliances, kitchen equipment, laundry equipment, boilers, pool equipment, HVAC, hand and power tools and general plumbing systems and fixtures such as pipe lines, toilets and sinks, kitchen and laundry equipment.
5.	Service the hotel's pool, including adjusting chemicals and cleaning filters; completing maintenance request forms and record logs.
6.	Maintain the building exterior and "curb appeal" (e.g., snow removal, lawn care, painting, gardening).
7.	Refurbish furniture and fixtures within guest rooms such as cabinets, tables, chairs, doors windows and counters. Paint and finish furniture and fixtures if needed. 
8.	Respond in a courteous manner to all guest questions, complaints, and/or requests to ensure strong guest satisfaction. 
9.	Exposure to extreme temperatures.
10.	Operation of heavy machinery.
11.	Comply with attendance rules and be available to work on a regular basis.
12.	Perform any other job related duties as assigned.

Prior Hotel experience Preferred.  Must have the ability to communicate in English.  Self-starting personality with an even disposition.    Maintain a professional appearance and manner at all times.     Can communicate well with guests.  Must be willing to “pitch-in” and help co- workers with their job duties and be a team player.  Climbing, reading, standing, walking and routinely lifting 25 lbs to 50 lbs.   Must be able to receive instructions and communicate progress of work assignments.

title: Architectural Draftsperson/Project architect
description:
Architectural design firm located in Brooklyn specializes in new construction and renovation of commercial, residential and mixed-used buildings currently seeking a full time Architectural Drafter to join our team.

Required Skills:

Working in a team at all phases of a project design, and submission to the DOB, construction documents, construction administration, and project administration of building projects from start to finish under the direction of  Staff.

Knowledgeable of  building code and zoning requirements effect the design of the projects.

Review DOB objections with the team to develop best strategies for addressing objections that still meet both code, and design intent.

Translate the firm's design intent into design drawings, submissions to the DOB, and construction documents while ensuring the integrity of that design intent throughout the life of the project.

*Able to read consultant drawings for building projects and work with the project team to integrate consultant's scope of work into the firm's drawings.  Such consultant drawings you should have experience with include structural, mechanical, electrical, plumbing, geotech, expeditors, lighting, and acoustical consultants.

Addressing redlines, markups, comments, and direction from Senior Staff and revising project drawings and documents accordingly.

Proficient in completing Quality Assurance Checklists on projects.

Self-checking work and cross-checking work across other drawings for the project to ensure drawings are always the most current and accurate.

Able to review Contracts and Project Schedules to support team in ensuring projects stay on schedule, that work on the project is performed according to Contract scope, and advise Senior Staff if you feel an item is requested on a project that might be out of project scope per the project's Contract.

Support Senior Staff in ensuring client satisfaction on projects.

Advise Senior Staff whenever you are given conflicting priorities, feel you'll miss a deadline, are struggling with a task or need more direction so a collaborative solution can be made together.

 
Qualifications:

Degree in either Bachelor of Architecture or Architectural Technology.

0-5 years work experience, at least 1 year of Experience drafting in the AEC Industry preferred.

Ability to think creatively and strategically to develop solutions for the team.

Complex problem solving and decision making skills.

Ability to work both independently and collaboratively while being a team member who enjoys succeeding in a team environment.

Flexibility in a fast-paced changing environment.

Experience with NYC building code, NYC Energy Code, NYC Zoning Resolutions, NYC Department of Buildings filing processes, and ADA code knowledge preferred.

 
Salary and Benefits:

Salary commensurate to experience. we offer many benefits to employees including healthcare contribution, transit check participation, direct deposit, flexible work hours, paid half hour lunch breaks, time off for ARE testing, time off for holidays and most USA holidays, and a Personal Time off and Unpaid Time off Plan.

To apply, please send resume, cover letter, and work samples.

title: Field Electrical Technician
description: Our client is seeking an experienced  electrical engineer for a long-term assignment. The job is split between company offices in Westchester County and rail yards in NYC. Must be able to run and understand tests, create related report and recommendation for solutions. Requires strong knowledge of electronics, both hardware and software, computer technology including network and email settings and expertise with train or subway technology definitely preferred. Car needed to get to the job. Hours are often  afternoon to night as well as weekends as needed. Pay rate is $25/hour based on experience. May also have overtime. Immediate !!!

This role is primarily responsible for customer support and collaboration with our Sales + Design team.  

Confidence, a clean design aesthetic, the ability to spark interest in others, direct customer interaction and experience in the selling of high-end designed products are a must. Candidates must have the ability to organize their own time, multitask in a dynamic environment, be proactive, and above all else…problem solve. We are looking for someone who is eager to connect with people and translate their needs into timeless experiences and products. To be successful, candidates must have a strong interest in the creation of high-end products. compensation: This role offers a competitive salary in addition to inclusion in the company’s profit sharing, 401K, medical, and dental programs.

title: Floor Plan Measurer: AS-BUILT Drawings $50/hr
description:
We have an immediate opening for a floor plan measurer. This is a flexible position for part-time work (contractor). You will set your own schedule and we will fit appointments into your availability (M-F, 9-5 only). 

Applicant must be highly experienced in creating as-built condition drawings (floor plans) of residential and commercial properties in CAD. Applicant must have the ability to create CAD drawings on-site using own laptop and AutoCAD software. Taking measurements on paper and later transferring to CAD drawings is NOT acceptable. Applicant must use a laser tape measure on-site.

Applicant must:
- Have a good understanding of building construction
- Be highly-proficient in CAD
- Have availability during normal weekday business hours: 9-5 to survey properties (please do not apply if you are looking for after-hour or weekend appointments.)
- Have own vehicle to visit properties
- Be reliable and very detail oriented

There are no set number of measurements in a day or week as appointments vary from week to week. We prefer a candidate with lots of availability but can set up as many or as few appointments as desired. This is a great, flexible opportunity for the right candidate.

Compensation: $50 per hr plus $10 travel and $10 per diem

Please send email with your previous work experience and education. 
You must use the following subject line in your email: "Re: Floor Plan Measurer - New York"
compensation: $50 per hour plus $10 travel and $10 per diem

title: Career Opportunity in Engineering for Immigrant Professionals
description:
The Cooper Union Retraining Program for Immigrant Engineers @ CAMBA  assists immigrant Engineers and IT Professionals who are underemployed or unemployed gain access to higher paying jobs through training and job placement assistance. The program includes courses in information technology and mechanical, electrical and civil engineering taught by Cooper Union faculty and field experts.  All services are free and admission is competitive. 
Classes Available:

Engineering: 
- OSHA 30 for Construction 
- Heating, Ventilation, Air-Condition & Refrigeration
- Building Operation, Maintenance & Safety Regulations
- National Electrical Code (NEC) & its applications
- Bridge, Highway, Tunnels and Buildings: Professional Practice for Cost Estimating
- Green Building Guidelines & Environmental Safety
- AISC Structural Steel Design 
- ACI Structural Concrete Design
- AutoCAD and Revit

Information Technology: 
- Data Architecture Principles, Data Structure and SQL
- Java Programming
- Microsoft .NET and C#
- Software Quality Assurance—Manual Testing
- Software Quality Assurance—Automated Testing
- Linux (UNIX) Administration
- Android Software Development
- Cyber Security

Eligibility Requirements:
- Be born outside of the United States and be authorized to work in the United States
- Have a bachelor's degree or higher and professional experience in the field of engineering, information technology, or a related field from the country of origin (not from U.S)
- Have lived in the U.S. less than five full years
- Be unemployed, underemployed, or working in a field not related to your education
- Have intermediate+ English fluency
- Demonstrate a financial need
- Be highly motivated to pursue professional job search

You can learn more about us and apply here:  www.cooper.edu/immigrant-retraining.
compensation: Free Training with Job Placement Assistance

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Mechanical Engineer with B.S.M.E. or B.S.A.E. 
5-10 years of experience in the Design of HVAC, controls, plumbing and sustainable systems.  The Mechanical Engineer's primary responsibility will be HVAC design for a wide range of projects including commercial offices, healthcare, laboratory, universities, government projects, etc.. 
Duties will include design calculations, design drawing development, energy and life cycle cost analysis, cost estimation, specifications, performance based controls design, coordination within design team, client communication, construction administration, technical oversight and mentoring of junior engineers, and collaboration with senior staff for system selection and quality assurance.   
Possession of, or ability to obtain, security clearance and U. S. Citizenship required.

description:

Plumbing, electrical, HVAC systems, lighting, carpentry, drywall, plastering, door/lock repair, etc.
Experience with all building systems including HVAC systems, fire protection systems, security/access systems, elevators, BMS, etc.

title: Lead Project Architect / "Starchitect" Designed Towers
description:
Known for executing some of the most ambitious mixed-use towers in the world, this NY based practice is currently developing serveral multi-billion dollar mixed use and commercial programs (high rise towers), designed by some of the worlds foremost design talent. These are extremely complex programs, which require deep collaboration between Designers, Executive Architect, Owner/Developers, and major corporate tenants (major tech and fortunate 500 corporations). 
Under guidance of Partners, Project Architect will lead the development of the documentation, manage and mentor team members (jr. staff) and represent the firm at all meetings with clients, consultants and other key members of the project. 

Preferred profile: Sr. Architect (10+ years) with demonstrated technical proficiency, and strong knowledge of systems and building process. Revit proficiency preferred - not required (will train). Must also demonstrate good communication skills (written and verbal) ability to work in team environments and lead initiatives with clients. 

Will also be willing to groom intermediate level architectural professional (5 - 7+ years) into leadership position, provided they have solid technical fundamentals, learned through participation on built/completed projects (local preferred) and demonstrated Revit proficiency. 

All qualified resumes will receive immediate response. Extremely competitive compensation, benefit and PTO package offered. Office respects and promotes "work/life" balanced culture.

title: Electronic Assembler
description:
**GENERAL INFO**
Small Electrical Engineering Company
Precision assembly of electronic parts under a microscope. 

Come join our small team of RF engineers! Located conveniently on the border between Floral Park and Queens, we are seeking an organized and detail-oriented individual with a background in J-STD-001 and IPC-610 standards. In this hand-on position, you will support continuous testing and development activities lead by our highly capable RF engineers.

**JOB DESCRIPTION & REQUIREMENTS**
• Basic knowledge of capacitors, resistors, and inductors. 
• Assemble precision surface mounted components onto a PCB under a microscope.
• Able to read and assemble PCB's from schematics and parts lists (BOM).

**ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS**
• Trained to work to J-STD-001 and IPC-610 standards.
• Minimum of 1 to 5 years of experience.

**PROFESSIONAL SKILLS**
• Ability to communicate effectively with and technical and non-technical employees.

Send resumes/cover letters in response to this ad.
Visit us as www.luffresearch.com for more information

title: Estimator required
description:
RMZ CONTRACTING company is seeking senior and junior estimators to join our family. Compensation commensurate with experience. Below are some of the skills required; although character, willingness to learn and work hard will be considered.
• Review construction drawings & specifications, conduct field visits and gather all material and data necessary to determine scope of work and organize a construction cost estimate.
• Prepare detailed cost estimates for residential, commercial and institutional projects, utilizing Sage Timberline Estimating software.
• Prepare and organize material takeoffs utilizing On-Screen Take Off (OST) software for accuracy and seamless transition to Project Management Team.
• Ability to create project schedules/timelines utilizing MS Project software.
• Establish job costs through analysis of vendors/sub-contractor quotations for material/services.
• Develop the scope of work for sub-contractors and assist account executive in preparation of buy-out package.
• Maintain digital file of working documents as back-up for estimating database, including quotations and notes.

Desired Skills And Experience

MUST
• Strong understanding of the NYC Construction environment as applied to urban exterior restoration and general knowledge of the estimating process, including blueprint and specification reading, as well as material and labor costs.
• Proficiency in rigging requirements and experience in exterior masonry, roofing, flatwork/garage and historic preservation.
• Outstanding organizational skills. Must possess a structured, logical, and methodical approach to problem solving. Must be able to meet deadlines and manage time effectively.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Must be able to effectively work with production team, from Project Managers to office staff to sub-contractors. Must be effective in directing and supporting the work of others.
• Outstanding attention to detail. Ability to effectively recognize issues and discrepancies in bid documentation.
PLUS

Knowledge of MS Project, On-Screen Take Off, SAGE Timberline Estimating Extended and AutoCAD software.
• Bachelor's degree in architecture, engineering or related discipline, or equivalent combination of technical training and experience.
• At least five (5) years’ experience in Construction Estimating with a proven track record of accuracy, efficiency, and profitability.
. Knowledge of Real Estate would be  ideal

title: Facade / Building Envelope Structural Engineer
description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer with 3 to 7 years of building envelope restoration experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer (9+ years)
description:
Do you want to help develop a pioneering solution to one of the biggest healthcare problem facing our country?   

We are a tech-startup (funded initially by NIH) looking for experienced mechanical engineers. 

**We will only consider candidates with 9+ years at med-tech / pharma**

About the Senior Mechanical Engineer role:
Required - do not apply unless you have 
•	9+ years of work in a regulated industry (specifically medical devices)
•	7+ years of proven product design and project management experience
•	7+ years of experience working with contract manufacturers (domestic and international)

The ideal candidate will display the commitment and dedication necessary to guide complex projects, as well as the capacity to take ownership of tasks and proactively oversee all resources involved. You will work with an internal team of electrical, mechanical, and software engineers, while working with suppliers and healthcare professionals to carry our products from problem statement through to large-scale production.
 
Candidates must be able to work quickly, seamlessly shift between technical requirements and non-technical explanations, and think outside of the box to find simple solutions to complex engineering issues. A successful candidate will have the ability to scrutinize every dimension of a mechanical system, while also ensuring all decisions are made towards the goal of achieving our broader product vision as an integral part of our business development strategy. Candidates must be familiar with good documentation practices as well as the various steps necessary to bring a regulated product to market, this includes FMEA, GDT, V&V, QA, QC, Design, Simulations, and Prototyping. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

 
Qualifications:
•	Experience launching a high-volume consumer electronic device
•	MS in mechanical engineering; PMP preferred
•	Strong foundation in mechanical engineering concepts
•	Fluency in Solidworks for 3D modeling and FEA simulation
•	Thorough knowledge of GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices)
•	Excellent technical writing skills and documentation practices
 
Additional Qualifications (nice-to-haves):
•	Previous medical device and/or pharmaceutical experience preferred
•	Understanding of the current regulatory requirements as per FDA and ISO guidelines for medical devices
•	Experience launching multiple high volume products
•	Experience with waterproofing and IPXX
•	Experience with designing robotics systems on the cm/mm-scale
 
Responsibilities:
•	Lead a structured product development effort, from start to finish.
•	Schedule preparation and planning (Gantt charts)
•	Resource forecasting
•	Tracking engineer availability and overall project status
•	Enforcement of project timelines and budgets
•	Design mechanical and electromechanical system to meet product goals.
•	3D model, built, test, and refine prototypes while considering how they would scale to medium and high volumes.
•	Facilitate communication at regular intervals between management, engineers, and regulatory team.
 
A portfolio showcasing thoughtful design engineering strongly preferred, but not required. If you will be submitting a portfolio, please share it as a link in your note when you apply.

Salary and option package commensurate with experience and skill set.

About us:
MedicaSafe is a growing company that specializes in creating technology to manage high-risk medications, with a focus on improving treatment for opioid use disorder. We are developing our second-generation product - a handheld medication dispenser, paired with a mobile app and web platform for treatment management and reporting. We are raising a series B round later this year to fund commercialization plans.  
 
SEARCH FIRMS
MedicaSafe, Inc is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails.

description:

title: Certified Water Technologist & Cooling Tower 7G Pesticide Applicator
description:
We are an environmental engineering consulting company. At present, we want to expand our portfolio of services in New York City metropolitan area and increase our market penetration. We are seeking to fill two positions: Certified Water Technologist & Cooling Tower 7G Pesticide Applicator
