title: Architect AutoCAD
description:
Busy Queens Architectural firm [www.ArchitectsStudioNY.com] seeking an Intermediate CAD Draftsperson with project mgmt duties for new mid-rise Residential/Commercial base buildings, alterations and Interior Renovation projects. 

The  individual will work directly with the Principal Architect to manage and administer each phase of the project, and coordinate incoming and outgoing information on a day-to day basis. 

Qualifications:
-Multi-tasker - capability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
-Knowledge in Construction Details
-Ability to efficiently manage project hours
-Knowledge of NYC Building Codes, NYC Zoning Ordinances
-Full engagement of projects
-Knowledge of NYC Zoning Resolution, NYC Building Codes, ADA Regulations
-Able to work under pressure to meet deadlines
-Primarily an office-based position but some travel required for project meeting and other related duties
-Proficient drafting skills using AutoCAD, including layer management
-3D & Computer Rendering skills is a +.
-Minimum 3 years of construction technical work experience 


Ideal candidates are those looking for growth through long-term employment and must be able to work overtime when required. Firm offers health benefits and 401K participation opportunity.  PLEASE ANSWER ONLY IF YOU LIVE IN THE AREA (NYC) & CAN WORK LEGALLY IN THE U.S.

Email cover letter  and resume [in pdf format] with desired compensation to us with confidence. Any other format will not be viewed.  Please indicate CAD under subject line on email.

title: HVAC Counter Sales / Customer Service / Estimator
description:
HVAC Rep/Distributor is looking for an inside-sales associate to join our company.  We have been in business since 1963 due in part to the hard work & dedication of our employees.  We are looking to add the right person to our team. You should be interested in a long-term career and be technically minded with a willingness and ability to learn.


Responsibilities:

-Answer phone calls & emails
-Help customers with product selections
-Prepare customer quotations
-Review mechanical drawings
-Prepare engineering submittals
-Create factory purchase orders


Requirements:

-Good Communication & telephone skills
-Computer literate (MS Office) 
-Be a team-player 
-Ability to multi-task 
-Must be punctual (7:30 am)
**Must be technically minded or a logical thinker**

Engineering Degree or Trade School Certificate preferred but not required.
Previous experience in the HVAC industry preferred but will train the right person.

The position is full-time M-F 7:30-4:30 
401K & Medical 

Please send COVER LETTER and resume.

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer (9+ years)
description:
Do you want to help develop a pioneering solution to one of the biggest healthcare problem facing our country?   

We are a tech-startup (funded initially by NIH) looking for experienced mechanical engineers. 

**We will only consider candidates with 9+ years at med-tech / pharma**

About the Senior Mechanical Engineer role:
Required - do not apply unless you have 
•	9+ years of work in a regulated industry (specifically medical devices)
•	7+ years of proven product design and project management experience
•	7+ years of experience working with contract manufacturers (domestic and international)

The ideal candidate will display the commitment and dedication necessary to guide complex projects, as well as the capacity to take ownership of tasks and proactively oversee all resources involved. You will work with an internal team of electrical, mechanical, and software engineers, while working with suppliers and healthcare professionals to carry our products from problem statement through to large-scale production.
 
Candidates must be able to work quickly, seamlessly shift between technical requirements and non-technical explanations, and think outside of the box to find simple solutions to complex engineering issues. A successful candidate will have the ability to scrutinize every dimension of a mechanical system, while also ensuring all decisions are made towards the goal of achieving our broader product vision as an integral part of our business development strategy. Candidates must be familiar with good documentation practices as well as the various steps necessary to bring a regulated product to market, this includes FMEA, GDT, V&V, QA, QC, Design, Simulations, and Prototyping. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

 
Qualifications:
•	Experience launching a high-volume consumer electronic device
•	MS in mechanical engineering; PMP preferred
•	Strong foundation in mechanical engineering concepts
•	Fluency in Solidworks for 3D modeling and FEA simulation
•	Thorough knowledge of GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices)
•	Excellent technical writing skills and documentation practices
 
Additional Qualifications (nice-to-haves):
•	Previous medical device and/or pharmaceutical experience preferred
•	Understanding of the current regulatory requirements as per FDA and ISO guidelines for medical devices
•	Experience launching multiple high volume products
•	Experience with waterproofing and IPXX
•	Experience with designing robotics systems on the cm/mm-scale
 
Responsibilities:
•	Lead a structured product development effort, from start to finish.
•	Schedule preparation and planning (Gantt charts)
•	Resource forecasting
•	Tracking engineer availability and overall project status
•	Enforcement of project timelines and budgets
•	Design mechanical and electromechanical system to meet product goals.
•	3D model, built, test, and refine prototypes while considering how they would scale to medium and high volumes.
•	Facilitate communication at regular intervals between management, engineers, and regulatory team.
 
A portfolio showcasing thoughtful design engineering strongly preferred, but not required. If you will be submitting a portfolio, please share it as a link in your note when you apply.

Salary and option package commensurate with experience and skill set.

About us:
MedicaSafe is a growing company that specializes in creating technology to manage high-risk medications, with a focus on improving treatment for opioid use disorder. We are developing our second-generation product - a handheld medication dispenser, paired with a mobile app and web platform for treatment management and reporting. We are raising a series B round later this year to fund commercialization plans.  
 
SEARCH FIRMS
MedicaSafe, Inc is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails.

title: Electronic Assembler
description:
**GENERAL INFO**
Small Electrical Engineering Company
Precision assembly of electronic parts under a microscope. 

Come join our small team of RF engineers! Located conveniently on the border between Floral Park and Queens, we are seeking an organized and detail-oriented individual with a background in J-STD-001 and IPC-610 standards. In this hand-on position, you will support continuous testing and development activities lead by our highly capable RF engineers.

**JOB DESCRIPTION & REQUIREMENTS**
• Basic knowledge of capacitors, resistors, and inductors. 
• Assemble precision surface mounted components onto a PCB under a microscope.
• Able to read and assemble PCB's from schematics and parts lists (BOM).

**ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS**
• Trained to work to J-STD-001 and IPC-610 standards.
• Minimum of 1 to 5 years of experience.

**PROFESSIONAL SKILLS**
• Ability to communicate effectively with and technical and non-technical employees.

Send resumes/cover letters in response to this ad.
Visit us as www.luffresearch.com for more information

title: 3D Render Artist Needed
description:

AutoCAD | Rhino | Revitt

title: DOB Filing Representative- Freelance
description:
Job Description
Filing Representative needed to file DOB Architectural filing set and certificate of correction in Manhattan NY.

Must have Class 1 or 2 Filing Representative License.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

DOB (Department of Buildings)

1. Pre-filing and E-filing for job filings (ALT 1, 2, 3, Demo, PA)
2. DOB Now Build
3. DOB Now Safety
4. DOB Now Inspections:
Schedule Construction, Plumbing, Electrical inspections
Delegate pertinent parties
Download Pass - Final Reports and submit for sign-off
Upload corrections for certifiable objections
5. DOB Permits PW 1, PW 2, PW 3, PW4, After hour variances
6. Site Safety Plans
7. Records Room research: microfilm, block and lot, folder
8. Post Approval Amendments
9. Violations (AEU2, AEU20, Dismissals, Waivers)
10. Stop Work Orders, Partial Stop Work Orders
11. Obtain New DOB Tracking Number for Contractors and insurance updates
12. Required Items submission
13. Letter of Completions
14. Temporary and Final Certificates of Occupancy
15. Schedule and attend Plan Examiner appointments to obtain approvals
16. Attend Chief Plan's examiners meetings with Architects, Engineers, Developers, Property Managers
17. Attend meetings with Deputy Borough Commissioners
DOT (Department of Transportation)

1. DOT Permits: Sidewalk, Fire Hydrant, Curb Cut
ECB (Environmental Control Board)
1. Attend ECB hearings
2. Process penalty payments

TOPO (Topographical Bureau)

1. Street Address Verification
DOF (Department of Finance)

1. Tax Maps

FDNY (Fire Department of the city of New York)

1. Submit applications
2. Obtain Building Profiles, Notices of Violation and Violation Orders
3. Attend appointments

title: Junior Architect
description:
Small Architectural / Interior Design firm located in the Upper West Side, specializing in residential and commercial projects, seeks talented Junior Architect. Work will consist of assisting in all phases of schematic design, development, preparation of DOB drawings and applications, construction documents, construction site visits, archiving and general office activities.  Candidates must be highly motivated, quick learners, with a passion for architecture and desire to learn and grow. Excellent AutoCAD drafting abilities and 3D rendering are a must. Candidates must be responsible, organized, punctual, reliable, have good communication skills, and be team-players, capable of multi-tasking and focused on producing accurate results.  
 Please reply ONLY if you:
1. Previous working experience in an Architectural firm is a plus 
2. send pdf work samples of similar work ONLY   
3. send a cover letter and your resume  
4. indicate your availability You reply must include response to all 4 requirements

Please send email to career@43hundred.com

description:
We are an established and awarded small architectural firm located in Manhattan. Our projects cover public buildings and educational facilities. We are looking to hire talented individuals who have the potential and ambition for growth towards positions in office leadership.
Our office organization enables staff members a hands-on experience. Working on multiple projects and different phases of work, including design, construction documents and job administration. Our transparent office environment provides exposure to all aspects of the practice.

Our Firm specializes in commercial restaurants in the tri-state area, and primarily NYC. Tasks will be for all stages of projects from site surveying & schematic layouts, to developing construction documents and filing with the department of buildings.

Ability to work with minimal supervision

Must be detail oriented and diligent in assuring work is done correctly
Professional communication skills are a must
Ability to work under tight deadlines and switch priorities as needed

Attributes:
Ability to follow instruction
Excellent work ethic
Deadline and detail oriented
Must be able to problem solve

*Please note this position is located in Northern NJ and is accessible by car or bus only. Please apply only if you are able to easily commute.

title: Design Director / Hospitality (Brand)
description:
Hospitality brand with global footprint, delivering the highest quality guest experience - seeks Global Design Director to work directly with VP of Design and SVP Development in the execution of several large scale projects in various stages of design, ongoing in the US and Asia. 
Will will work with top-line management in the development of strategy, planning, design direction, review and selection of all design consultants, oversight and management of all work produced. Will have several direct reports including but not limited to FF&E team, Project Managers and Sr. Managers executing various elements of the program. Will establish goals (budget and schedule) and hold all partners accountable. Will hold all parties to the highest standard of excellence in design and be capable of communicating a clear vision or philosophy to the entire team. 

Requirements: 10+ years experience in hospitality design, experience managing teams and executing high profile, completed projects. Demonstrated experience maintaining brand consistency and enhancing brand position through strategic design objectives. Must demonstrate strong communication and organization abilities. Ability to build teams, set high standards and achieve goals. 

*Must be capable of heavy travel schedule. Open to relocation.

title: Assistant Project Manager
description:
Job Description:

The Assistant Project Manager will be an integral part of Think Construction, working directly with Project Managers to ensure that every job runs seamlessly. Extreme attention to detail and superior organization are key. The daily responsibilities of the Assistant Project Manager will include maintaining the flow of information between our company and architects, clients, and subcontractors. Candidates must work closely with our site and office teams and will be accountable for the trafficking of all project-related communications--fielding questions, providing submittals, creating schedules, keeping meeting minutes, and more. 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as superior planning and organizational abilities, are required. At Think Construction, we believe strongly in promoting a positive, respectful, supportive, collegial, and collaborative work environment. We believe in creating a work environment that encourages hard work, professionalism, and opportunities for continued learning and growth. We look for candidates who share our vision.

Job Responsibilities:

• Schedule/attend coordination meetings with subcontractors and suppliers
• Obtain pricing and lead time from suppliers/subcontractors
• Track/adjust project schedule and submittals
• Monitor/record/distribute design changes that affect workflow, schedule and budget
• Prepare and execute fixture and material orders 
• Assemble change orders and maintain budget
• Analyze blueprints and prepare estimates 
• Prepare submittals and RFIs for transmittal to architects and designers
• Liaise with architects, site-supers, sub-contractors, and vendors to coordinate work and traffic
• Record and issue minutes of field meetings

Job Requirements:

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
• Ability to consistently multi-task in several capacities on a variety of projects
• Aptitude for meeting deadlines and facilitating others to do so as well
• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word and Adobe Acrobat
• Some experience reading blueprints and specifications
• Familiarity with Procore is a plus

title: Restoration Project Manager
description:
Brooklyn based Restroration Building company seeking a Project Manager with 5-10 years of experience in managing landmark preservation construction projects through all phases including scope of work and budget development, scheduling, condition assessment and reporting, construction document review (drawings and specifications), and construction administration.

The Project Manager will be responsible for the assessment and restoration of masonry, steel, and reinforced concrete structures; façade & roofing repairs and replacement; LPC submission, inspections and reporting.

The construction team works with the leading architects and engineers in building restoration to execute complex and difficult projects. They provide innovative restoration, preservation and building solutions to the owner, building manager, preservationist, architect or engineer in every phase of planning, production and project management.

Great office culture. Exceptional benefits. Perfect time to join a growing firm with a stellar reputation.

title: Expeditor/Project Manager
description:
Job Description

Reporting to the Architect/Owner responsible for:
Managing architectural and construction projects from pre-filing to sign-off. Coordinate and manage required items list and squad leaders list at Manhattan Borough office.
Work directly with clients to expedite general filings, corrections, submissions, payments, etc.
Manage DOB HUB and DOBNOW filings
Filing work permits and Processing Temporary Certificates of Occupancy applications. Manage and Track Temporary Elevator sign-offs for Temporary Certificates of Occupancy.
Manage and updated 18 Month Construction inspections sign-offs
Coordinating the payment at the the Department of Buildings
Regularly work with other city agencies to process various documents related to construction projects in the five boroughs.
Interact effectively with city agency officials and company clients.

Requirements:

Associates Degree, Architecture or Engineering preferred but not required.
High level of organization, planning, prioritization and attention to detail.

Salary:
$45,000.00-$50,000.00

Benefits:
Paid Vacation
Paid Sick/Personal Days
401k and Company match
Unlimited Metro card

Job Type: Full-time

title: Intermediate Architect | Residential Interiors
description:
Project Management/Leadership Role

Responsibilities also include hands on construction document production using AutoCAD or Revit.
Manage Team.
Manage Projects.
Professional Growth!

High Profile New York City substantial multi-family residential architectural interiors projects.

New York City DOB approvals and code and zoning experience is required.

title: Drafting Position - SSP/TPP/OPP's - Experienced with AutoCad
description:
We are a construction consulting firm with a Full Time position open for an AutoCad Drafter and Code Consultant.

We are willing to teach the ropes to the right candidate but candidate must be proficient in AutoCad and have a good grasp of the English language.
 
The candidate selected will be working with staff to measure job sites and prepare:
 
•         Existing conditions site plans;
•         Staging and logistics plans for presentation to the NYC Department of Transportation.
•         Site Safety Plans for work required to comply with Chapter 33 of the NYC Building Code.
•         Occupant Protection Plans for submission to the NYC Department of Buildings.
•         Tenant Protection Plans for submission to the NYC Department of Buildings.
•         Construction equipment plans.  
•         Temporary Place of Assembly Plans.  
 
Candidate will be working from our office near Penn Station, Manhattan and will use the latest version of AutoCad.
 
 
Please reply with resume, sample drawings, and salary requirement.


KEY WORDS: SITE SAFETY, OCCUPANT PROTECTION PLANS, TENANT PROTECTION PLANS, AUTOCAD, DRAFTING, EXPEDITING, CONSTRUCTION, PLAN DRAFTING, DOB, DOT, FDNY
compensation: Salary, Major Medical, Dental Stipend, paid sick leave, incentives, etc.

- Must have 5-year Bachelor of Architecture degree and minimum 3 years working experience in single family residential design and mixed-use buildings 
- Must have knowledge of NYC zoning and building codes
- Must be able to develop design concepts into a full set of construction drawings independently
- Must be a very organized team player with excellent communication skills. Must feel comfortable/confident to be the liaison between office, clients, contractors and consultants
- Strong AutoCad skills 
- Must have or be able to secure a DOB Expediters License.
- Must be able to manage multiple projects EMAIL YOUR RESUME.

title: FULL TIME JUNIOR ARCHITECT
description:
A growing New York City based, boutique architectural & interior design firm seeks to hire a full time Junior Architect to work on multiple high-end residential projects. The applicants must have related experience for the Junior Architect's position in New York City with knowledge of residential detailing, shop drawings and superior AutoCAD skills. The qualified candidates will need to be enthusiastic, hard working, well-organized and highly motivated w/excellent verbal and written communications skills.

Candidates will work from company's office with the firm's principal and team to produce highly detailed designs, construction documents and manage all aspects of architectural projects during construction. Supervision available to assist w/completion of NCARB Intern Development Program.

Only those with an architectural degree and with experience in high-end residential construction and detailing will be considered. In addition, experience with interior design and furnishings, a good knowledge of fine fabrics and furniture and first hand experience with D&D Building & NYC area vendors is a bonus, but not required.

Candidate must be competent to understand filing processes and be able to accomplish things on their own. 

Search words DOB, DOT, ECB, HPD FDNY , PERMITS, EXPEDITING, MANAGER,  EXPEDITOR, FILING, VIOLATION, DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS, CLASS 1 , CLASS 2  

Salary $40,00 to $70,000, 10 paid days per year + National holidays.

If you don't know what your doing don't apply. You will be tested during your interview.

description:
Known for executing some of the most ambitious mixed-use towers in the world, this NY based practice is currently developing serveral multi-billion dollar mixed use and commercial programs (high rise towers), designed by some of the worlds foremost design talent. These are extremely complex programs, which require deep collaboration between Designers, Executive Architect, Owner/Developers, and major corporate tenants (major tech and fortunate 500 corporations).

Must also demonstrate good communication skills (written and verbal) ability to work in team environments and lead initiatives with clients. 

Will also be willing to groom intermediate level architectural professional (5 - 7+ years) into leadership position, provided they have solid technical fundamentals, learned through participation on built/completed projects (local preferred) and demonstrated Revit proficiency. 

All qualified resumes will receive immediate response. Extremely competitive compensation, benefit and PTO package offered. Office respects and promotes "work/life" balanced culture.

title: ARCHITECTURAL DRAFTSPERSON
description:
Well established, Brooklyn-based architectural firm is looking for an enthusiastic, hardworking, quick learner to join our team.

•	Bachelor's degree in Architecture or related Architectural Drafting qualification
•	Two to five years' experience working in NYC: DOB & FDNY, NYC Zoning Resolution, ADA Regulations
•	Expertise in AutoCAD required
•	Knowledge of good drafting techniques and familiarity with MEP engineering and construction terminology
•	Exceptional communication skills, verbal and written
•	Excellent computer technology skills

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer (9+ years)
description:
Do you want to help develop a pioneering solution to one of the biggest healthcare problem facing our country?   

We are a tech-startup (funded initially by NIH) looking for experienced mechanical engineers. 

**We will only consider candidates with 9+ years at med-tech / pharma**

About the Senior Mechanical Engineer role:
Required - do not apply unless you have 
•	9+ years of work in a regulated industry (specifically medical devices)
•	7+ years of proven product design and project management experience
•	7+ years of experience working with contract manufacturers (domestic and international)

The ideal candidate will display the commitment and dedication necessary to guide complex projects, as well as the capacity to take ownership of tasks and proactively oversee all resources involved. You will work with an internal team of electrical, mechanical, and software engineers, while working with suppliers and healthcare professionals to carry our products from problem statement through to large-scale production.
 
Candidates must be able to work quickly, seamlessly shift between technical requirements and non-technical explanations, and think outside of the box to find simple solutions to complex engineering issues. A successful candidate will have the ability to scrutinize every dimension of a mechanical system, while also ensuring all decisions are made towards the goal of achieving our broader product vision as an integral part of our business development strategy. Candidates must be familiar with good documentation practices as well as the various steps necessary to bring a regulated product to market, this includes FMEA, GDT, V&V, QA, QC, Design, Simulations, and Prototyping. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

 
Qualifications:
•	Experience launching a high-volume consumer electronic device
•	MS in mechanical engineering; PMP preferred
•	Strong foundation in mechanical engineering concepts
•	Fluency in Solidworks for 3D modeling and FEA simulation
•	Thorough knowledge of GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices)
•	Excellent technical writing skills and documentation practices
 
Additional Qualifications (nice-to-haves):
•	Previous medical device and/or pharmaceutical experience preferred
•	Understanding of the current regulatory requirements as per FDA and ISO guidelines for medical devices
•	Experience launching multiple high volume products
•	Experience with waterproofing and IPXX
•	Experience with designing robotics systems on the cm/mm-scale
 
Responsibilities:
•	Lead a structured product development effort, from start to finish.
•	Schedule preparation and planning (Gantt charts)
•	Resource forecasting
•	Tracking engineer availability and overall project status
•	Enforcement of project timelines and budgets
•	Design mechanical and electromechanical system to meet product goals.
•	3D model, built, test, and refine prototypes while considering how they would scale to medium and high volumes.
•	Facilitate communication at regular intervals between management, engineers, and regulatory team.
 
A portfolio showcasing thoughtful design engineering strongly preferred, but not required. If you will be submitting a portfolio, please share it as a link in your note when you apply.

Salary and option package commensurate with experience and skill set.

About us:
MedicaSafe is a growing company that specializes in creating technology to manage high-risk medications, with a focus on improving treatment for opioid use disorder. We are developing our second-generation product - a handheld medication dispenser, paired with a mobile app and web platform for treatment management and reporting. We are raising a series B round later this year to fund commercialization plans.

Job Description:

The Assistant Project Manager will be an integral part of Think Construction, working directly with Project Managers to ensure that every job runs seamlessly. Extreme attention to detail and superior organization are key. The daily responsibilities of the Assistant Project Manager will include maintaining the flow of information between our company and architects, clients, and subcontractors. Candidates must work closely with our site and office teams and will be accountable for the trafficking of all project-related communications--fielding questions, providing submittals, creating schedules, keeping meeting minutes, and more. 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as superior planning and organizational abilities, are required. At Think Construction, we believe strongly in promoting a positive, respectful, supportive, collegial, and collaborative work environment. We believe in creating a work environment that encourages hard work, professionalism, and opportunities for continued learning and growth. We look for candidates who share our vision.

Job Responsibilities:

• Schedule/attend coordination meetings with subcontractors and suppliers
• Obtain pricing and lead time from suppliers/subcontractors
• Track/adjust project schedule and submittals
• Monitor/record/distribute design changes that affect workflow, schedule and budget
• Prepare and execute fixture and material orders 
• Assemble change orders and maintain budget
• Analyze blueprints and prepare estimates 
• Prepare submittals and RFIs for transmittal to architects and designers
• Liaise with architects, site-supers, sub-contractors, and vendors to coordinate work and traffic
• Record and issue minutes of field meetings

Job Requirements:

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
• Ability to consistently multi-task in several capacities on a variety of projects
• Aptitude for meeting deadlines and facilitating others to do so as well
• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word and Adobe Acrobat
• Some experience reading blueprints and specifications
• Familiarity with Procore is a plus

title: Signal Engineer
description:
Tectonic is currently seeking full-time Signal Engineers to work on various building and infrastructure for upcoming MTA projects in the New York City area.

This position will provide Signal Engineers with the chance to work on high profile, challenging projects that offer the opportunity for professional growth and advancement within the A/E/C industry working for a Top ENR 500 Firm. 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

The essential functions of this position include traveling to various project sites on a daily basis and perform daily surveillance and inspections to verify that all work performed by the Contractor has been completed in accordance with the contract requirements, along with being responsible to ensure quality hold points are being observed and witness all applicable inspection and testing required under the Contract. The Signal Engineer will access and conduct field inspection to enforce NYCT rules and regulations involving the daily field construction need and to ensure contractors are incompliance with all pre-requisite for the work tasks being performed in the field, as well as proper and safe working environment are set up and field works are adequately covered. Such pre-requisite will include but not limited to approve drawings, materials, obtain proper permits and procure NYCT support services such as flagging protection, G.O. and work trains. The Engineer will discuss and coordinate work activities with contractors and field inspectors and will review and ensure that daily reports are properly and accurately recorded with details. Essential functions also include the preparation of Daily Field Reports, communication of deficiencies observed in the field to project managers, contractors, and/or client representatives, and the interpretation of project-related drawings and documents, as well as all other duties as assigned. Field inspectors will prepare detailed daily inspection reports and records all contractor and NYCT personnel on site, work performed, materials used and any incidents and non-conformances occurred in the field.

TO VIEW AND APPLY, PLEASE VISIT: 

QUALIFICATIONS

•	Candidates must possess the following certifications AND a High School Diploma/equivalent:
o	OSHA 30 Hour Safety 
o	Lead Awareness
•	Ability to complete Track Safety and PMG 123 Training Certification;
•	Effective oral and written communication skills; 
•	Must be detail oriented;
•	A valid, clean driver’s license and personal vehicle to travel to job sites is preferred; as regular daily travel is required to various project sites primarily throughout the New York City metro area; 

COMPETITIVE SALARY AND BENEFITS PACKAGE
•	Comprehensive group medical insurance, including health, dental, vision and life
•	Opportunities for professional growth and advancement
•	Tuition reimbursement
•	Paid time off, including vacation, sick and personal
•	Company–observed paid holidays
•	Short and long-term disability coverage
•	Flexible spending accounts for medical expenses and dependent care
•	Commuter benefit plan for public transportation costs
•	401K retirement and profit sharing plan.

We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, and highly encourage resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities. All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected class.
Tectonic participates in the USCIS E-Verify Program to verify that all new hires are authorized to work in the United States.

title: Change Management -Design Strategy for Architecture Firm
description:
Title:Senior Workplace Strategy + Change Management - Full Time Employee Career Position

Company Description:New York City office of architecture and design studio that focuses upon creative, world class workplace interiors projects.

Brief Overview: 
Influence and guide change, providing strategies and tools to support workplace, end-user behavior,  work practice, culture, and technology transformations. 
Develop and deliver changes in employee experience & workplace design solutions. 
Conduct research and user-centered design thinking activities, experiential workshops, journals, ideation and prototyping. Develop and implement change management strategies. 
Participate in industry events, networking and relationship building to advance customer relationships.  
Requirements include:
Completion of higher education degree in a related field of study.
8+ years of related leadership experience in workplace strategy, change management, or corporate psychology.  Related experience in design, real estate analysis or portfolio planning. 
Organizational development and/or change management experience. 
**PROSCI certification a plus**
compensation: Approximately 130K, base salary negotiable depending upon years and level of prior experience.

• Executing each project phase including pre-construction, construction, closeout and post-construction services.
• Working in partnership with the Project Superintendent to maintain an updated and accurate project schedule. Attending weekly meetings and keeping minutes
• Thorough completion of all financial data with an eye to quickly identify potential/existing issues that could lead to subpar financial performance.

Qualifications
• Proven advanced experience in project and construction management with a general contractor

Please email your resume and if possible, supply a list of projects you have worked on from start to finish.

title: Construction Inspector - Civil/Structural
description:
If you are bold. If you are willing to be original and take risks. If you want to make a difference by improving our infrastructure, then you should be an AV-ator! Alta Vista Solutions nurtures its AV-ators to perform as leaders in our industry, providing innovative engineering solutions and embracing our clients’ challenges as our own. Our mission is to Do Right and give back, while providing a great place to work for our professionals who provide solutions for some of the country’s biggest and most complex infrastructure projects. If you want to make an impact; if you want to solve problems; if you want to have fun while learning and growing; then join Alta Vista and become an AV-ator. 
 
Job Summary: 
 
Alta Vista Solutions is seeking a construction inspector with prior experience on bridges and roadways or rail for project on Long Island and in and around New York Metro Area. This individual will be performing inspections of the construction activities including concrete, steel, and rail work. 
 
Key Responsibilities: 
 
Perform inspection of contractor’s work to ensure construction activities are in accordance with plans, specifications, and contractual requirements. 
Perform and/or observe on-site material testing. 
Read and comprehend contract documents (i.e. plans, specifications, shop drawings). 
Provide thorough inspection reports and maintain detailed records of work performed. 
Perform additional duties as assigned. 
 
Minimum Qualifications: 

High School Diploma or GED required 
Minimum 5 years construction inspection required 
Experience as Construction Inspector on bridge or rail projects required 
NICET certification preferred 
OSHA 10 or 30 hour training preferred 
Experience with LIRR, NYSDOT, MNR, TBTA or other local agencies preferred

title: Goshow Architects seeks Project Architects to join our team in New Yor
description:
Does the practice of architecture excite you? Are you an architect who thrives on helping your coworkers and clients to achieve their best? Are you looking to have an impact on a team of smart, talented, and super fun people? Are you looking to strike the perfect balance between professional and personal obligations and aspirations? If so, we want to meet you!

Our Project Architects are intermediate level design professionals who act as assistant team leaders responsible for technical and design aspects of our projects. They develop high-quality design and construction documents through hands-on work and coordinate all project issues with consultants, and manage production staff through efficient task delegations and leadership.

DESIRED EXPERIENCE

5+ years of experience in Architecture office (2-3 years minimum preparing construction documents)
Experience in developing and designing complex & custom details and following them through the construction phase.
Experience developing, organizing, and exercising quality control over drawings and drawing sets
Experience with consultant coordination and ability to recognize deficiencies in consultant-provided content .
Experience conducting material research and meeting vendors to understand materials and products.
Experience “redlining” drawings and delegating production work while being conscious of project deadlines, fees, and contractual obligations.
Experience with oversight and mentorship of junior-level staff through completion of submissions.
Experience organizing and leading site visits and surveys.
DESIRED SKILLS / EDUCATION / CERTIFICATIONS

Professional degree in Architecture Required (B.Arch or M.Arch)
Strong communication & organization skills
Strong time management skills
Advanced knowledge of AutoCAD and Revit
Strong understanding of NYC/NYS codes and NYC zoning regulations
Strong knowledge of building construction, materials, and systems
Licensed Architects preferred
LEED accredited Preferred
Public sector experience preferred
 
To apply, e-mail your cover letter, resume and work samples to jobs@goshow.com.  Please put Project Architect in the subject line.

title: Senior Landscape Designer/Architect
description:
VERDANT is looking to add a Senior Landscape Designer/Architect to our eclectic team of Designers, Horticulturists and Installers.

The ideal candidate has 5-7 years of high-end residential experience as project leader, is comfortable in a variety of project frameworks and has excellent client management and communication skills with extensive technical and plant knowledge.
The new team member should be self-motivated, have a passion for what she/he does and be able to deal with the day to day demands of each project without little guidance. 

We are looking for somebody with a strong and positive presence that is able to guide and direct team members and has an ambition for creative growth and an interest in leading the company to the next level.

Experience and skills needed:
•    BA in Landscape Architecture or related field
•    5+ years strong design and project management experience, from broad conceptualization through construction documentation and administration.
•    Managed a minimum of 8 built projects requiring multi-disciplinary collaboration and coordination, (including architects, building boards, structural engineers, technical consultants)
•    Understanding of projects costs, budgets and contracts
•    Ability to work independently with little to no guidance
•    Extensive client interaction as project manager, ability to manage their expectation, fulfill deliverables and project schedules
•    Strong understanding of typical building techniques in an urban framework
•    Strong horticultural knowledge demonstrated through both design and built work
•    Knowledge of DOB, Landmarks Preservation and Building board submissions
•    Extensive working knowledge of AutoCAD R2015, Sketch-up, Photoshop, In-Design, Illustrator; Rhino, 3D Max a plus but not essential
• Sense of Humor
• Valid work permit

Please send resume, portfolio and cover letter to info@verdantgardens.com

For more information about us, please visit : www.verdantny.com
No phone calls please! No recruiters please!

We are passionate about what we do each day and appreciate a good sense of humor in an exciting, at times, fast-paced industry.

• Completed a minimum of 2 built projects requiring multi-disciplinary collaboration and coordination, (including architects, building boards, structural engineers, technical consultants)
• Ability to work independently with little supervision
• Experienced with client interaction

• Hands-on, technical knowledge highly desired

title: Estimator
description:
Fast growing Queens based company looking for a competent/diligent estimator to prepare accurate estimates for projects. 

Responsibilities include but not limited to:

 Analyze blueprints and written specifications for pricing to aid management in bidding on and or determining value of project. 
Understanding the project and it’s requirements. 
 Be able to review and perform full breakdowns of construction drawings, specifications and bid forms. 
Determine key variables for cost and other factors. 
Conduct research to obtain data on labor costs, materials, production times etc. 
Use software for data analysis, forecasting and budgeting. 
Perform risk analysis. 
Create and submit estimate reports or bids to appropriate persons. 
Provide consultation on planning. 
Submit 100% of bids by bid deadline. 

Requirements:

Proven experience/schooling as estimator. 
Familiarity with financial and project management principles. 
Knowledge of research and data analysis methods and estimation formulas. 
Proficient in relevant software. 
Excellent communication and negotiation abilities. 
Must have excellent organizational skills as well as thoroughness and reliability. 
Self motivated, seeks long range advancement. 
CPE (Certified Professional Estimator) will be an asset. 

Salary negotiable.

•	Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite as well as Design Software

KEY BENEFITS:

•	Health, Dental, and Vision coverage

•	401k with company match

title: Construction Estimator.....temp to perm....NYC
description:
Our client, a construction management firm located here in Manhattan, is looking for a quality Estimator to join its team on a temp to perm basis.  The selected candidate will have at least 5 years of estimator experience……experience using On Screen Takeoff program software is a must…some position duties appear below……..a civil engineering degree is preferred…….for consideration, please send resume in Word………



Prepare estimates by calculating complete takeoffs of scope of work, work collaboratively with groups to discuss feasibility, contact subcontractor to provide bids for trades, prepares subcontractor evaluations and commercial estimates per bid procedure, process and distributes all R.F.I.s for estimating and job addendums and prepare the proposal to submit to the client.
Read and review blueprints and specifications to form a scope of work for every trade. Perform quantity takeoffs for the various materials by using On Screen Takeoff program. Secure bids for each trade, then quantify their scope and pricing. Summarize, compare and level several quotes from trade arriving with best
price for the project. Create procedures for tracking, distributing and maintaining of all the project documentation.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Mechanical Engineer

We are a full-service Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing Engineering Consulting firm with multiple locations throughout the United States. Our New York City office is seeking a Mechanical Engineer to work on a wide variety of commercial and high tech buildings. 

Responsibilities:

Designing HVAC systems, load calculations, scheduling and selecting equipment, specification writing & construction administration. 
Completing Commissioning and HVAC inspections in the field. 
Research, develop, and design mechanical systems and processes to meet client requirements while applying engineering principles.
Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, schematics and computer generated reports. 
Become a complementary member of our team as a whole, and on a project-by-project basis;
Produce work using computer aided design/drafting hardware and software.
Work on several projects at one time.
Field measure and document existing buildings
Produce and coordinate construction drawings with other disciplines.

Salary Range: 75,000.00  to 115,000.00 
Bonus plan, Full Benefits & Vacation Days.



Job Requirements

Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering.
Minimum of 4+years of HVAC design, preferred emphasis in commercial, labs, data centers and high tech buildings.
Strong communication, report writing, organization, analytical and interpersonal skills;
Working knowledge of the design standards and codes for NYC building design;
A high level of technical and organizational skill accompanied by strong oral and written communication;
Working knowledge of design software (AutoCAD MEP, Trane Trace), Revit MEP preferred;
Working knowledge of standard computer software, such as Excel and Word.

title: Plumbing/Fire Protection Engineer
description:
We are a world-class multi-disciplinary engineering consulting firm who is seeking a Plumbing/Fire Protection Engineer for our New York, NY office. 

Responsibilities 

Our engineers work on high quality, high-profile, national and international projects. We are currently looking for engineers who will be responsible for the systems design of commercial, institutional, healthcare, and laboratory projects.

Responsibilities include:
• Development of initial Pluming and Fire Protection system concepts
• Design of Plumbing and Fire Protection systems
• Calculation of preliminary water, gas, sanitary/sewer and storm loads for utility coordination
• Develop project specifications
• Survey and evaluation of existing conditions
• Construction administration
• Assist with Project Management
• Attend client meetings 

Requirements 
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Civil or Environmental Engineering preferred. 
2- 15 years’ experience designing plumbing and fire protection systems preferred. (Project experience submitted for consideration should include buildings on which you have actively participated in the project from the design phase through the final construction close-out.) 
Strong working knowledge of building, plumbing, and fire codes 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
Current PE and LEED AP licenses/registrations are preferred. 
Special consideration will be given to those candidates who have successfully demonstrated innovative design experience specifically related to renewable energies and sustainable, high performing buildings.

Our company offers salary commensurate with experience, a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, disability and life insurances, 401k plan, tuition reimbursement, and more.

title: Junior-Intermediate Interior Designer
description:
MARKZEFF is currently seeking a talented, responsible, ambitious Junior-Intermediate Interior Designer for immediate full-time employment to work on high-end residential and hospitality design. We are looking for a sharp individual who is detail-oriented, and who likes to experiment with new ideas and materials. The candidate must be equally able to take direction and work independently as needed while being fully accountable for all project assignments. They will also need to be team-spirited, willing not only to listen but also contribute to a creative design dialogue. Curiosity, discernment, resourcefulness, and drive are important.

Persons interested must also have the following requirements:
•	3 years of residential experience with a Bachelor degree in Interior Design or related preferred. 
•	Hospitality experience a plus but not required.
•	Project management & FFE selection & purchasing experience required.
•	Site/fieldwork experience. Experience in construction. 
•	Position includes managing all phases of the design process including schematic, design development, FFE selections, FFE purchasing, and generating & maintaining project budgets for highly customized hi-end residential projects. 
•	Full knowledge of FFE specifications selection, furniture drawings, specification documentation & submittals is required. 
•	Strong presentation skills are necessary.
•	Strong written & verbal communication skills.
•	A keen eye and attention to detail. 
•	Must be highly motivated with a strong work ethic.
•	Must have the ability to work autonomously, manage various projects effectively and follow up.
•	Must have strong time management skills and the ability to remain flexible while multi-tasking.
•	Ability to work on short time frames and complete projects on tight schedules. 
•	Organizational skills with a proven ability to complete successful projects on time and within budget. 
•	Meeting deadlines is a must.
•	Microsoft Office(Word, Excel, Outlook), Photoshop, Adobe Professional/Nitro, CAD. 
•	Spexx & 3D Max preferred, but not required. 
•	Administrative skills required. 
•	Interest and aptitude to work in extremely fast-paced office culture.

title: Goshow Architects seeks Project Managers to join our team in New York
description:
Does the practice of architecture excite you?  Are you an architect who thrives on helping your co-workers to achieve their best?  Are you looking to have an impact on a team of smart, talented, and super fun people?  If so, we want to meet you!  

We are seeking a licensed design professional with a passion for leading, mentoring and collaborating to join our team as a Project Manager.

This person oversees the design, production and administration of multiple and/or complex projects.  

This person is directly responsible both to the client and the firm for successful execution of the project. 

And equally important, this person will lead multi-generational project teams and therefore must be a great communicator and fun person to be around.

NOTE: Ideally, we are looking for candidates licensed in the U.S. with Public Sector architecture experience.

Qualifications:

Registered Architect in the U.S.
Professional degree in Architecture
5 - 20 years of hands-on project management experience.
Thorough knowledge of architectural design, drafting, detailing, building materials, building codes, construction techniques and costs.
Knowledge of CADD, basic knowledge of 3D computer modeling software
Proven experience in effectively leading a project team.
Strong analytical, oral and written communication skills with the ability to build quick rapport with all levels of employees, clients, consultants and vendors.
**Local candidates within the NYC metro and surrounding region only**

Goshow Architects is a New York based architectural firm founded on the principle that architects have a social responsibility to design healthy and sustainable environments to work, learn, and live in.  

 
To apply, e-mail your cover letter, resume and work samples to jobs@goshow.com.  Please put PROJECT MANAGER in the subject line.

title: Field Super, Project Coord, & Admin
description:
We are a Brooklyn based Commercial Ornamental Metal & Glass Sub Contractor that has been in the business for over 10 years. We have projects located within the five boroughs and work with all the major General Contractors in the City. We are certified with City, Empire State, MTA and SCA as a minority business.
 
We are seeking motivated candidates who are self-starters, proactive, and problem solvers to grow and advance within our team.  We are looking to hire both Junior and Senior levels, with Bachelors Degree.  Please send a resume and a cover letter with salary requirement and examples of previous work.
 
Field Supervisor/Construction Supervisor

Roles and Responsibilities:

·         Visit multiple job sites to oversee work performed by on-site crews or by vendors or subcontractors off-site for fabrication and assembly work
·         Perform quality control inspections and make sure work is done according to contractual requirements and specifications

·         Attend meetings on site and at client’s offices (SCA/MTA) and interface with project managers and clients.
 
Qualifications, Requirements and Experience:

·         Able to read and follow construction drawings/blueprints and specifications
·         Experience with overseeing site crew on a construction project
·         Experience with the installation of ornamental metals & glass, metal finishing and fabrication
·         Familiar with MTA Track Training
·         Must maintain OSHA 30 and other required certifications
·         Have strong written and oral communication skills
·         Must be detail-oriented, adaptable and efficient
·         Must be able to perform initial site surveys
·         Must have a driver’s license
 
·         Proficiency in MS Office and CADD
·         At least 3 years’ experience in architectural construction
·         Candidates should have a certification or a degree in or related to the following fields: Architecture, Engineering, Project Management, Construction Management.
 
Project Coordinator

Roles and Responsibilities:

·         Create project proposals from templates and vendor/contractor quotes
·         Create submittal packages for project materials and scope
·         May be required to do drawings or schematics for small projects
·         Request and follow up on quotes for work from vendors or contractors
·         Send drawings out to vendors and contractors for pricing
·         Perform architectural take offs, including labor and material
 
Qualifications, Requirements and Experience:

·         Driver’s license
·         Able to read and interpret construction drawings/blueprints and specifications
·         Must have knowledge of the miscellaneous steel industry
·         Familiar with the ornamental metals & glass and metal finishing
·         Must have strong written and oral communication skills
·         Able to meet demands and deadlines
·         Strong leadership and interpersonal skills
·         Must be proficient in MS Office, Adobe Acrobat, and CADD
·         At least 3 years’ experience in architectural construction
·         Candidates should have a certification or a degree in or related to the following fields: Architecture, Engineering, Project Management, Construction Management.
 
Administrative Assistant

Roles and Responsibilities:

·         Prepare and track certify payroll MTA/SCA, both manually and electronically
·         Prepare and track union dues, both manually and electronically
·         Regular payroll on ADP & QuickBooks
·         AP/AR
·         Prepare and AIA Schedule of Values
·         Track business invoices – payments and billing
·         Prepare project documentation: quotes, proposals, transmittal sheets, contracts, RFIs, and others as requested –        MS Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word
·         Put together and follow up on submittal packages for project materials and scope
·         Request and follow up on quotes for work from vendors or contractors
·         Place material and office supply orders including follow up on deliveries or returns
·         Assist with Audits, put together and provide documentation as requested
·         Send emails and other communications to clients, vendors and contractors
·         Organize and file office mail and other documentation
·         Answer office phones
 
Qualifications, Requirements and Experience:
          Bachelor Degree 
·         Driver’s license, a plus 
·         Must have strong written and oral communication skills
·         Able to meet demands and deadlines
·         Strong leadership and interpersonal skills
·         Must be proficient in MS Office, Adobe Acrobat, and Quickbooks
·         At least 3 years’ experience in architectural construction
·         The ability to read and interpret construction drawings/blueprints and specifications is a plus

title: Mechanical Designers
description:
Mechanical Designers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded interdisciplinary research group based in New York City.  These hires will work on the mechanical design and construction of new generations of our custom-built ANTON® supercomputer, collaborating with our team on all phases of system development, from concept to delivery.  This is a limited-term position with an anticipated 12-month contract.

Successful candidates will have expertise in sheet metal and machined part design, including hands-on prototyping and testing of chassis and enclosures, and modeling and drafting in SolidWorks and/or PTC Creo (Pro/Engineer).  They should have a demonstrated ability to design complex, rack-based electronic packaging systems with integrated power and cooling.  Other relevant experience might include plastics design and injection molding, creating assembly drawings, and resolution of DFM/DFA issues.  Excellent analytical and communication skills are required.

We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation to candidates of exceptional ability.

Our research effort is aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below:


D. E. Shaw Research is a New York-based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the fields of biochemistry and molecular biology.  Among the group's current activities is the development of specialized supercomputers designed in part to fundamentally transform the process of drug discovery.

D. E. Shaw Research is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to the goal of building a diverse workforce. We welcome inquiries from all exceptionally well-qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, nationality, national or ethnic origin, religion or religious belief, caste, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, caregiver status, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, disability, or status in any other category protected in this regard by law in any jurisdiction in which the Firm operates.

description:
Long established fine metal fabrication company using the latest technology including state of the art lasers, CAD/​CAM, waterjets, shears, numerical punching machines, press brakes, engineering, and a diverse workforce seeking candidates with Mechanical Engineering background.
This position is not for square foot take off construction estimating or project management.  


This position entails a number of responsibilities and requires familiarity with a variety of disciplines as summarized below:

Reading, interpreting and understanding drawings (CAD) and hard copy
Preparing manufacturing labor and material cost estimates for projects, including liaison with manufacturing, engineering, purchasing and sales to provide the most cost effective process.​
Corresponding and quoting customers relating to their project and to clarify project information
Communicating with architects, designers, contractors, manufacturers (OEM) etc
Corresponding with vendors to determine costs related to raw materials and purchased services
Responsible for follow up of quotes
Developing and maintaining good customer relationships

This position requires the following skills:
Ability to read architectural drawings and blueprints (CAD and hard copy).​
Strong command of basic math, trigonometry and geometry is required.​
Ability to problem solve
Strong team player with excellent people and communication skills
Ability to learn quickly.​
Experience in sheet metal/​manufacturing industry is very helpful
General computer literacy
Constant customer contact via telephone and email.

We offer a challenging, exciting work environment with competitive salary, bonus opportunity and excellent benefits.​ We also provide ample room for professional development and growth!


Please reference the job title in the subject line.
Please submit a cover letter.

When attaching a resume file, please include your first and last name in the file name to facilitate retrieval 
(eg. JohnSmithResume.doc not Resume1.doc).
RESUMES NOT NAMED IN THIS MANNER WILL NOT BE PROCESSED AND REVIEWED.

title: Construction Project Manager
description:
Construction Project Manager - This person will work closely with the Project Team ensuring commercial projects are completed on time and within budget. 5-10 years project management experience.
 
 
Summary:
 
Performs various functions assigned by the Project Manager and Team. Tasks may involve:
• Support the implementation of procurement, phasing, scheduling and logistic strategies.
• Assistance in procuring project material and products.
• Conducting research.
• Scheduling and updating project data.
• Knowledge of commercial interior office fit outs, retail, healthcare with experience with DOH.
• Experience with processing all logs. (RFI's, Submittals, Change Orders, etc..)
• Experience with estimating and bid process.
• Excellent communication abilities, multitasking and exceptional organizational skills.
• Reading blueprints and general understanding of Architectural and MEP drawings.
 
 
Duties:
 
Work closely with the Project Team:
• Manage various project services, i.e.: estimating, change orders, scheduling, finance and contract administration.
• Generate Construction schedules, Long Lead Procurement schedules and Agendas.
• Monitor and update logs during the shop drawing and submittal process.
• obtaining proposals from sub-contractors and multiple trades during bidding.
• Assist in managing all aspects of the construction process.
• Communicating and coordination with vendors, Architects, sub-contractors, inspectors and expediters in respect to each project.
 
Computer Skills & Qualifications:
 
• Proficient in MS Office, Excel Power Point and Project.
• CAD a plus.
• Planswift Estimating Software a plus.
• Other essential skills should include time management, organizational skills, negotiation and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.

title: CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGER/ ESTIMATOR
description: CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGER/ ESTIMATOR - Minimum of 5 yrs. experience.  Busy construction office. Must be able to read blueprints, specifications and related documents.  Computer literate and good customer service skills for soliciting business.

title: Intern - Architectural / Construction Mngmnt
description:
NYC Flatiron - small office specializing in interior design & construction management is seeking architecture student or recent graduate who is looking to gain PRACTICAL work experience. Architectural::   shop-drawings, technical design & research development
Construction Management::   in-construction projects - review of Archt plans & schedules work scope, estimating trades & materials / products, research, site visits during construction
Office Administrative::  library organization, website updates, marketing (web blog articles, google add words, facebook, SEO web, etc), office procedures updates

Desired qualifications:
A. Organized & detail oriented
B. Graphic design skills
C. Writing & communication skills: phone calls, office communication, email correspondence, etc.

This is for someone who is looking to learn lots & raise their professionalism, so as to advance onto the next career level.  Or someone who is looking to obtain school credits.
Please either e-mail a link to your portfolio website or send your resume w/ PDF sample of school projects  (images to be bound in 1 pdf, please do not send exceedingly large files – no more than 5mb!)

Last, precisely answer the following 3 items in your reply e-mail to:
nycstudio2016 at yahoo dot com

2) Availability  (A) When you can start (date),     (B) length of term - months) availability   and    (C) what days/hours (daily & during the week)   you are available

Thank you.

title: Expediting C of O coordinator
description:
Established Expediting Company seeks experienced full time Project Manager  / Sign off coordinator

We are explicitly looking for someone that has experience with the NYC Department of Buildings. 

You will be responsible for:

Preparation of Amendments and close out documents and related applications for filing with the Dept of Buildings, HUB and DOBNOW for all types of applications. You will also be responsible for tracking filing of applications and C of O's, automatically renewing TCO's, apply for meetings with Borough Commissioners and Project Advocates.
You will also meet with applicants, property managers, and homeowners. Provide updates to clients by detailed emails, creation of spread sheets and reports to be sent to clients, as well as tracking and coordination of all of your work through company established methods.
We extensively use the following programs and you must be proficient in all of these applications:
E-Filing, Word, Excel, PermitPro, Adobe and Exchange

Requirements:

- Excellent writing skills
- The ability to speak clearly
- Must be a team player
- Good memory
- Ability to remain calm and clear under stress
- Strong organizational skills 
- Be fluent in English
- Punctuality is a must
- Must present yourself professionally

Position is available immediately for the qualified experienced person we are looking for. Our company offers competitive salary, health coverage and 401K

***** If you do not have NYC Expediting experience, if you do not know the DOB forms, and you cannot read drawings, please do not apply for this job. We will ask you questions pertaining to forms,applications and procedures.

Please send your resume and your salary requirements. We look forward to hearing from you. 

We are not looking for Drafters, or Architects. Thank you.

title: Hotel Engineer wanted!
description:
The Fairfield Inn - WFC is seeking a FT Engineer to:

JOB OVERVIEW:  Perform general maintenance work to ensure hotel maintenance quality standards are achieved and maintained.

REPORTS TO:	Chief Engineer

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: 

1.	Assist with preventative maintenance and complete report work orders such as replacing ceiling tiles, light bulbs, patching vinyl, etc., to maintain the hotel and keep the product quality standard.  
2.	Perform preventative maintenance assignments on a scheduled basis (e.g., "room care").
3.	Assist in checking electrical systems such as air conditioning controls, television sets, lighting systems, and make minor repairs and/or replacement.
4.	Assist in checking and making routine repairs and assist on major repairs of all hotel equipment including small appliances, kitchen equipment, laundry equipment, boilers, pool equipment, HVAC, hand and power tools and  general plumbing systems and fixtures such as pipe lines, toilets and sinks, kitchen and laundry equipment.
5.	Service the hotel's pool, including adjusting chemicals and cleaning filters; completing maintenance request forms and record logs.
6.	Maintain the building exterior and "curb appeal" (e.g., snow removal, lawn care, painting, gardening).
7.	Refurbish furniture and fixtures within guest rooms such as cabinets, tables, chairs, doors windows and counters.  Paint and finish furniture and fixtures if needed. 
8.	Respond in a courteous manner to all guest questions, complaints, and/or requests to ensure strong guest satisfaction. 
9.	Exposure to extreme temperatures.
10.	Operation of heavy machinery.
11.	Comply with attendance rules and be available to work on a regular basis.
12.	Perform any other job related duties as assigned.

For more information visit and to APPLY NOW please click link below:

title: Maintenance Manger
description:
United Cerebral Palsy Associations of New York State, Inc. d/b/a Constructive Partnerships Unlimited (CP Unlimited) is one of New York City's largest and most wide spread Community Living Organizations with programs dedicated to enhancing the lives of people with disabilities. CP Unlimited was formerly known as Cerebral Palsy Associations of NYS.  Our new name better reflects our wide array of services and programs and the diversity of people with disabilities that our agency supports.

CP Unlimited is currently seeking a Maintenance Manager to advise and schedule trade mechanics for maintenance and repairs for agency operated facilities, to assist us in our mission to provide safe and comfortable living environments for the people we serve. The Maintenance Manager will oversee the implementation of outsourced contracts applicable to building maintenance, life safety, and/or municipal, state and OPWDD regulations. Manage the agencies extermination & bed bug control programs. Conduct facilities assessments identifying, confirming and/or recommending modifications & enhancements pertinent to an aging population and outdated facilities.

To Quality for the position you must possess: 

Minimum of 5 years management experience within the skilled trades.
Knowledge of the practices and techniques of the trades in order to manage plumbing, electrical, carpentry, HVAC and masonry contractors.
PC skills, including MS Office Work and MS Excel
Good communication skills.
Experience preparing scopes of work, layouts, and cost estimates for renovation projects.
Experience working and collaborating with sub-contractors
Familiar with basic reading of blue prints and mechanical drawings.
Familiar with trade tools and equipment for the various trades.
Valid driver’s license. Willing to drive to/from all agency facilities.

CP Unlimited values and supports its employees by offering them competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. CP Unlimited invests in its staff over the long term and strives to provide opportunities for professional growth within the agency. The organization always has an eye to the future, exploring ways to improve and expand its services.

Please include your salary requirements. Apply by using the following link: 

EOE

title: Construction Manager
Business Development Leader
description:
CannonDesign has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Development Leader based in our New York City office. We are an integrated global design firm that unites a dynamic team of architects, engineers, strategists, futurists, researchers, and industry specialists driven by a singular goal - to help solve our clients' and society's greatest challenges.    

The successful candidate will be responsible for advancing the office, through business development, marketing, and public relations. Primary responsibilities include: 

• Work closely with office and firm leadership in creating and implementing a strategic business development plan to position the New York City office with target Health, Education and Commercial Interior clients. Assist in the identification of client leads based upon value propositions and strategic initiatives. 
• Develop and maintain a client network within our targeted business areas. Represent the firm at designated local professional conferences and industry events. 
• Work collaboratively with the office leadership to develop a strategic marketing business plan for the New York City office. Meet with the leaders on a regular basis to ensure that the marketing plan is implemented. Monitor business development activities and lead the tracking and reporting metrics. 
• Participate in the development of new business presentations, providing strategic client information gathered during research and market analysis. • Assist in research and intelligence gathering for potential client opportunities in an effort to better position the office to secure the commissions.
 • Work collaboratively with other business development professionals throughout the firm regarding firm-wide marketing and business development activities. 
• Collaborate with marketing team members in the writing, design, and implementation of marketing materials.
  
Qualified candidates must have a Bachelor in Marketing, Communications, Architecture, Engineering, or a related field. A minimum of 10 years of related industry experience with a proven track record in business development required. Experience in the Health, Education and/or Commercial Interiors and market place desired.  Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, Deltek CRM and/or Vision, and Salesforce preferred. Ability to travel domestically required. Must be collaborative, self-driven and entrepreneurial with the ability to maintain and prioritize deadlines. Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with an enthusiasm for innovation are a must. To apply upload your resume to our career site. Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site at .  It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us.  

As a condition of employment, all CannonDesigners are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required time frames and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.    

CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity. We consider all qualified employment applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, partnership status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Individuals who hold legal work authorization applicable to employment at CannonDesign in the United States will be considered without regard to citizenship/alienage.
